column1: celt.0.title;What is a King to an Emperor?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.0.desc1;You have driven out the Saxon invaders reformed the legendary kingdom of King Arthur and united all Britons under your banner. As the destined son of your people it is only natural that the bards and chroniclers heap praise upon your name. Recently some have even gone so far as to proclaim you Emperor of Brittania. While achiving Imperial dignity is the dream of any ruler in Europe the title of Empire is traditionally only attributed to Rome and we do not currently have the power to enforce our claim through force of arms alone.\n\n The bards have done much to legitimize your rule in the eyes of your people. Perhaps with the proper nudging you could convince them to focus their efforts on legitimizing your claim to an Imperial title in the eyes of the world.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.0.desc2;By uniting both the Gaels and the Brythons and driving out the troublesome Saxons you have proven yourself the undisputed master of the isles. Though not a Briton yourself you have recently noticed that your British subjects have begun including your family within their native myths and legends. Their bards call you the son of destiny
column2: the return of King Arthur
column3: and some even go so far as to name you Emperor of Britannia!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.0.a;Arthur was content to be king and so am I;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.0.b;I deserve a grander title;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.0.c;I prefer the Gaelic legends;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.0.d;Two empires are better than one;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
pursue_arthur_empire;Attempt to forge an empire through the power of words;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.1.title;Magnus Maximus;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.1.desc;Most of Europe considers Britannia to rightfully be a province of the Roman empire and those who dream of restoring the glory of Rome are not keen to recognize any empire but Rome within its old borders. According to the Brythonic chronicles and legend however Emperor Magnus Maximus
column2: known to the Britons as Macsen Wledig
column3: granted the sovereignty of Britannia to a Welsh chief in exchange for his daughter's hand in marrage. Although Maximus is now considered a usurper
column4: his gift of sovereignty could be a strong foundation for an imperial claim;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.1.a;I'd rather not build my legacy on the acts of a usurper;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.1.b;All shall hear of Britannia's independence!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.1.c;On his death we inherited his imperium!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2.title;King Arthur's Legacy;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2.desc;Despite never holding an imperial title
column2: King Arthur is exalted above all but the greatest emperors in terms of prestige and renown. As the ones who drove out the Saxons and united the Britons
column3: the Brythonic peoples consider the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] to be the spiritual successors of King Arthur. Sadly the subtleties of celtic prophesy are often lost on outsiders so our claim is not widely acknowledged outside our borders. Perhaps making my connection to King Arthur clearer would strengthen my imperial claim;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2.a;Arthur was never an emperor. This is a waste of time.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2.b;Lets clarify a few points;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2.c;It would make things a lot simpler to be related by blood;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.3.title;The Imperial Title;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.3.desc;The largest obstacle to any prospective empire in Europe is the insistance that only Rome should bare the title of Emperor. Your court bard has recently presented an idea that could make your imperial ambitions more palatable to the Romans. The title of Pendragon is one that carries unmatched dignity for the Britons. If we were to use Pendragon as our title rather than Emperor we could avoid any objections from Rome while still elevating our status above that of mere kings;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.3.a;Fussing about titles is a waste of time;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.3.b;Pendragon is a much nicer title anyway;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.3.c;What is the point of all this if I can't call myself Emperor?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.4.title;The Legend of [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName];;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.4.desc.best;After months of work I have managed to produce a new account that I believe should strengthen my claim to an imperial title. What's more the changes we made are so subtle as to be unnoticable. Of course it doesn't matter how plausable the story is if no one remembers it. In order to ensure that our version of events is embraced by the bards
column2: it should be committed to verse so it can be performed across the realm. The only question now is how much effort to commit to the task.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.4.desc.good;After months of work I have managed to produce a new account that I believe should strengthen my claim to an imperial title. Some of the claims made may stretch the truth a little but not enough to be unbelievable. Of course it doesn't matter how plausable the story is if no one remembers it. In order to ensure that our version of events is embraced by the bards
column2: it should be committed to verse so it can be performed across the realm. The only question now is how much effort to commit to the task.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.4.desc.bad;After months of work I have managed to produce a new account that I believe should strengthen my claim to an imperial title. The new version of events strain plausability and it is fairly obvious that it was created just to validate your imperial ambitions. Of course it doesn't matter how plausable the story is if no one remembers it. In order to ensure that our version of events is embraced by the bards
column2: it should be committed to verse so it can be performed across the realm. The only question now is how much effort to commit to the task.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.4.desc.worst;After months of work I have managed to produce a new account that I believe should strengthen my claim to an imperial title. Your new account is a total fabrication. You even heard some of your councilors suppress a laugh when you read it. Of course it doesn't matter how plausable the story is if no one remembers it. In order to ensure that our version of events is embraced by the bards;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
column2: it should be committed to verse so it can be performed across the realm. The only question now is how much effort to commit to the task.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.4.a;I will stake my very reputation! I will not stop until every bard in the realm is reciting these words!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.4.b;Gather the most renowned bards in the capital.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.4.c;My court bard should be sufficient. This is what I pay him for.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.4.d;My word is law! The bards will repeat what I say because I command them to.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.5.title;History Refuses to Change;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.5.desc;Despite your best efforts
column2: it seems as though your work has failed to catch on. Some say the stories are too far-fetched to be believable
column3: others say people simply prefer the old poems more. Whatever the reason may be you must now decide how to respond to this setback;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.5.a;Lets adjust some of the details to make the story more believable;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.5.b;I should have put more effort into spreading the story.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.5.c;I give up.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.6.title;The Power of Words;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.6.desc;Your new account of history has become a remarkable success! Not only are your words being recited by bards across the land
column2: but they are now being recorded in the written chronicles as well. With the historical record now showing strong evidence of your imperial claim it is now time to announce to the world that you are seizing what is rightfully yours. In order to silence the doubts of any sceptics jealous of our ascendancy
column3: the announcment should be accompanied by as much spectacle as can be mustered.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.6.a;Hold a celebration more spectacular than the world has ever seen;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.6.b;Lavish banquets! Month long festivals! Do it all!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.6.c;Prepare a ceremony but keep it dignified;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.6.d;The title is mine by right. I need no man's approval.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.7.title;Europe is not Amused;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.7.desc;No matter how much I insist the other rulers of Europe refuse to acknowledge my imperial title. Even worse my insistance is beginning to have diplomatic consequences. Many kingdoms are now refusing to accept any of our diplomats until we cease our use of the imperial title. There are two options before me. I can either give up my imperial ambitions or make another attempt to convince my peers.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.7.a;I will not rest until the world acknowledges my right!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.7.b;This isn't worth the cost;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.8.title;The Empire of the Britons;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.8.desc;After years of work I have finally achieved my dream! All throughout Europe acknowlege my right to an Imperial title and the Brythonic nation will forever be known as an Empire. Having surpassed even the greatness of King Arthur
column2: I will certainly be remembered by history as one of the greatest rulers to ever live!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.8.a;It was all worth it;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
arthur_empire_nope;Doesn't improve the strength of your claim but improves plausibility;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
arthur_empire_med;Increases the strength of your claim without decreasing its plausibility;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
arthur_empire_strong;Significantly increases the strength of your claim at the cost of plausibility;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
arthur_empire_change_story;Start again from the beginning;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
arthur_empire_try_again;Try again by committing more resources;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
arthur_empire_give_up;Abandon your quest;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.9.title;The First Gaelic Emperor;Le premier empereur Brittonique;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.9.desc;Long have the Celtic peoples stood divided
column2: easy pickings for conquerors over the millenia. From Julius Ceaser to Saxons and more
column3: the land has been constantly ravaged by warfare. Worse still
column4: most Celts had been robbed of their faith
column5: taught the ways of the Roman's dead god. But the faith of the Druids has been brought back from the brink of destruction! Now
column9: has united much of The Isles and declared [Root.GetReflexivePronoun] the rightful ruler of all Alba! Henceforth
column10: [Root.GetSheHe] shall be known as Emperor!;Il y a longtemps que les peuples celtes étaient divisés
column11: cueillettes faciles pour les conquérants au cours des millénaires. De Jules César aux Saxons et plus
column12: la terre a été constamment ravagée par la guerre. Pire encore
column13: la plupart des Celtes avaient été dépouillés de leur foi
column14: enseigné les voies du dieu mort romain. Mais la foi des druides a été ramenée du bord de la destruction ! Maintenant
column18: a uni une grande partie des îles et a déclaré [Root.GetReflexivePronoun] le souverain légitime de tous Prydain ! Dorénavant

column1: celt.9.a;Long may [Root.GetSheHe] reign!;Long règne à [Root.GetSheHe] !;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.13.title;Warbands Convert;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.13.desc;The ancient religion of the Celts has long been in decline. Now the faith appears to have finally vanished for good and soon none who remember the old gods will remain. However the Insular Christians
column2: following the example set by Saint Patrick to keep that which does not clash with the Word of God
column3: have preserved the old ways in a new Christian context. Now that the last of the pagan chiefs have dissapeared
column4: the roving warbands they once maintained have turned to their Christian kinsmen for support.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.14.title;The Red Dragon Knights Assemble!;Les Chevaliers du Dragon Rouge se rassemblent !;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.14.desc;An age of holy war is upon us. In order to better protect Insular pilgrims
column2: a group of holy warriors calling themselves the Red Dragon Knights have banded together to defend the faith. Following the example set by the holy orders of mainland Europe
column3: the Red Dragon Knights will fight for any Insular ruler capable of paying their maintanance
column4: but will not fight against other Insular Christians.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.14.a;May God guide their swords!;Que les dieux guident leurs épées !;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.14.b;This is getting out of hand...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.16.title;Imperator Scottorum;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.16.desc;The Gaelic people of Ireland and Great Britain experienced an era of learning and prosperity while the rest of Europe languished in a dark age after the fall of Rome. Attracted by its wealth and prestige
column2: the land of saints and scholars now faces constant invasions by jealous Saxons and Norsemen. In order to better protect their lands from invasion [Root.GetFullName]
column3: great King of the Gaels
column4: has united the kingdoms of Ireland and Scotland and declared [Root.GetReflexivePronoun] Imperator Scottorum. [Root.GetFullName] will surely be remembered as one of the greatest rulers the British Isles have ever seen.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.16.a;Long may [Root.GetSheHe] reign!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.16.b;They will fall all the same;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.16.c;Aren't there enough empires already?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
tooltip_completely_controls_ireland;Completely controls Éire;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
tooltip_completely_controls_scotland;Completely controls Alba;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.49.title;King of Mann;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.49.desc;Mann has long been overshadowed by the islands of Great Britain and Ireland and while the ruler of Mann has used the title of King in the past there are few who take this claim seriously. Now it seems our fortunes have turned as our great [Root.GetTitle]
column2: [Root.GetFirstNameWithNick]
column3: has expanded beyond the borders of our isle and brough wealth and prestige to Mann. From now on Mann will stand beside the great Kingdoms of Europe as an equal.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.49.a;Mann is created equal;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.51.title;Supporting the Papars;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.51.desc;Irish hermits
column2: referred to as the Papars by the foreigners
column3: have lived in small numbers in Iceland in order to isolate themselves from worldly concerns and focus solely on God. While the Papars have been content to forego the protection of the Gaelic kings for the sake of isolation
column4: the increasing activity of the Norse Vikings have made the North Sea a dangerous place. In order to protect the island from attack [supporter_of_papars_target.GetDynName]
column5: [supporter_of_papars_target.primary_title.GetRulerTitle] of [supporter_of_papars_target.primary_title.GetBaseName]
column6: has decided to settle many warriors and their families in Iceland. While the Papars are reluctant to give up their isolation
column7: their leader [papar_leader_target.GetFirstName] has decided to accept the proposal for the sake of the lives under his care.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.51.a;Interesting;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.52.title;Paris Engulfed;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.52.desc;The Seine
column2: the major river that runs through Paris
column3: has been running unusually high this year. Although the river is known to flood on occasion
column4: the waters have still been within safe levels. That is until a sudden torrential downpour caused the Seine to break free from its banks. Paris was engulfed by a flood the likes of which it has never seen before. By the time the waters finally receded
column5: Paris had been devastated.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.52.a;What a catastrophe;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.53.title;The City of Ys;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.53.desc;The people of Brittany speak of a magestic city named Ys that was swallowed by the sea in an age long past. Though Ys was destroyed long ago
column2: there are some who say that Ys will one day return when the city of Paris is engulfed. Curiously
column3: some days after Paris was submerged by the flooding of the Seine
column4: the waters of the Bay of Douarnenez receded
column5: revealing what appears to be ruins of a large city. Now Bretons are coming from far and wide to see the legendary city for themselves. Though these ruins hardly live up to the legends in their current state
column6: perhaps with some worth the city of Ys can be restored!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.53.a;What next? The return of Atlantis?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.54.desc;Victory is ours! How many generations of Cumbric men and women fought for this moment
column2: we do not know. But what we do know is that we are now truly the masters of our old lands
column3: Rheged
column4: and you her first monarch in many centuries.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.55.title;Rheged Restored;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.55.desc;Against great odds
column2: the Cumbric people have prevailed
column3: and now control much of their ancestral lands under the Kingdom of Rheged once more. Though they are but a small part of the British isles
column4: this victory could be just the beginning of greater things. Could Rheged reunite the Britons and reclaim the entire island?

column1: celt.56.desc;We have recently reclaimed land in Yr Hen Ogledd
column2: the Old North
column3: although the Saxons have dominated these lands for some time now
column4: our people have still lived as a minority within them. Now that the Saxons are fleeing in the wake of our expansion
column5: our people once again rise to a dominant position.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.56.a;Good Riddance;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.57.desc;We have recently reclaimed land in the old Kingdom of Dumnonia
column2: the former kingdom of the Cornish people
column3: although the Saxons have dominated these lands for some time now
column4: our people have still lived as a minority within them. Now that the Saxons are fleeing in the wake of our expansion
column5: our people once again rise to a dominant position.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.57.a;Good Riddance;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.58.desc;We have recently reclaimed land in Wales
column2: although the Saxons have dominated these lands for some time now
column3: our people have still lived as a minority within them. Now that the Saxons are fleeing in the wake of our expansion
column4: our people once again rise to a dominant position.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.58.a;Good Riddance;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.59.title;The Rebirth of Gaul;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.59.desc;The land of Gaul was once occupied by Celtic tribes in the ancient past and while the land has now long been conquered by the Romans and the Franks
column2: the memory of this ancient Celtic nation lives on. Now in a strange turn of events the land of Gaul is once again in Celtic hands. [Root.GetTitledNameWithNick] has declared the end of the rule of the Franks and the beginning of the Empire of Gaul;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.59.a;The rightful order has been restored;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.59.b;We conquered that fair and square;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.59.c;Those Celts are crazy;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.60.title;The Blood of Heroes;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.60.desc;Through a series of deft marriages
column2: the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty has established descent from many of the most famous figures from history. At the same time
column3: the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty has produced some of the greatest heroes of our age. Where the descendants of other famous bloodlines would be content to rest on their laurels
column4: members of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] bloodline have established a reputation for always searching for new ways to make a name for themselves.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.60.a;Impressive
celt.61.title;The Celtic Union;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.61.desc;The Celts were once the uncontested masters of Western Europe. Although the Celts have long been deprived of most of their lands and constrained to the remotest regions of Europe
column2: generations of struggle have allowed the Celtic peoples to reclaim their lost lands. Now [Root.GetTitledNameWithNick] has united three great Celtic Empires and has decided to form a single Celtic Union.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.61.a;None can deny our greatness;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.61.b;They are still not as great as we;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the High King will protect me from my enemies.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

dynastic_dominance_desc;The title of High King is mine by right as well as by might. My decendants should inherit the title from me.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

formalize_tribute_desc;The High King is entitled to tribute from the lesser kings of Ireland. If this tribute was formalized
column2: it would no longer need to be extracted by force;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: strengthen_authority;Strengthen authority of the High King;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
strengthen_authority_desc;The High King is supposed to be the foremost king in Ireland. It is time reality reflected this fact.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
demand_meath_submission;Demand The Submission of Meath;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
demand_meath_submission_desc;The King of Meath pays tribute but is still stubbornly independent. Meath will submit to my authority or there will be war!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
demand_ulster_submission;Demand The Submission of Ulster;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
demand_ulster_submission_desc;The King of Ulster pays tribute but is still stubbornly independent. Ulster will submit to my authority or there will be war!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
demand_leinster_submission;Demand The Submission of Leinster;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
demand_leinster_submission_desc;The King of Leinster pays tribute but is still stubbornly independent. Leinster will submit to my authority or there will be war!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
demand_munster_submission;Demand The Submission of Munster;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
demand_munster_submission_desc;The King of Munster pays tribute but is still stubbornly independent. Munster will submit to my authority or there will be war!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
demand_connacht_submission;Demand The Submission of Connacht;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
demand_connacht_submission_desc;The King of Connacht pays tribute but is still stubbornly independent. Connacht will submit to my authority or there will be war!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
unite_ireland;Unite Ireland;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
unite_ireland_desc;I have control of the whole island of Ireland. The High Kingdom will no longer be in name only;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.17.title;The High King of Ireland;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.17.desc;[Root.GetDynName]
column2: [old_primary_title.GetRulerTitle] of [old_primary_title.GetBaseName]
column3: has declared [Root.GetReflexivePronoun] High King of Ireland. The title of High King commands the highest respect among the Kings of Ireland
column4: and is owed tribute from all lesser Kings by right. Despite [Root.GetPossPronoun] lofty position
column5: without the strength to enforce [Root.GetPossPronoun] will on the other Irish Kings
column6: the High King's authority is unlikely to extend beyond the borders of [old_primary_title.GetBaseName];;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.17.a;Surely the other kings will fall in line;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.17.b;It takes more than words to be High King;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.19.title;A Dynasty of High Kings;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.19.desc;[Root.GetTitledName]
column2: having thoroughly established [Root.GetHerHis] authority over the lesser Irish kings
column3: has declared that the High Kingship will from now on be held exclusively by the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] Dynasty;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.19.a;This will end the squabbling over the High Kingship;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.19.b;Didn't we already do this?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.19.c;Not another one;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.20.title;An Orderly Succession;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.20.desc;The Uí Néill Dynasty has long claimed the High Kingship as its exclusive right. However
column2: the many branches of this vast family have done little more than fight among themselves over control of the High Kingship. To put an end to this squabbling
column3: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has declared that henceforth the High King will determine [Root.GetHerHis] successor;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.20.a;This time the squabbling over the High Kingship is surely at its end;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.20.b;But it was going to be my turn next!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.20.c;Perhaps I should take the High Kingship while I still can;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.21.title;A Peaceful Tribute;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.21.desc;While the High King has a right to tribute from the lesser Irish Kings
column2: traditionally he was expected to extract this tribute by force as a show of his power. [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to replace this with a more reliable form of tribute. After negotiating with [Root.GetHerHis] tributaries
column3: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has announced a new peaceful tribute;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.21.a;Work smarter not harder I always say;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.21.b;Its better than the old tribute at least;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.21.c;I wish [Root.GetFirstName] was my Suzerain;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.21.d;Look at the cowards too afraid to challenge the High King;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.22.title;High King In More Than Name;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.22.desc;Although the High King is supposed to be the overlord of all Irish king
column2: in reality the High King has little power outside of the kingdom he personally rules. [Root.GetTitledFirstName] aspires to change this by creating a High Kingship with real authority. [Root.GetTitledFirstName] is still a ways from making [Root.GetHerHis] dream a reality
column3: but [Root.GetHerHis] actions have begun to worry the fiercly independent Irish kings. The most powerful kings have one final chance to claim the High Kingship for themselves or break free of [Root.GetFirstName]'s influence or else they will lose their independance to a united High Kingdom.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.22.a;I will not stop until I am King of all of Ireland!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.22.b;[Root.GetFirstName] must be stopped before it is too late!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.22.c;I am in no position to challenge the High King;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.23.title;Rí hÉrenn Uile;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.23.desc;Since the time of the Fir Bolg
column2: through the age of the Tuatha Dé Danann
column3: and to the arrival of the Milesians
column4: the Island of Ireland has been ruled by a High King who claims hegemony over all other Irish Kings. Despite these lofty claims
column5: the High King rarely wielded any real influence beyond his borders. [Root.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick] is the first High King to fully subjugate the entire Island to [Root.GetHerHis] will. No longer content to be first of a multitude of Kings
column6: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has declared [Root.GetHerselfHimself] Rí hÉrenn Uile - King of All Ireland. Free from the constant feuding of the past
column7: Ireland enters a new golden age of prosperity under [Root.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick];;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.23.desc.brian;After a seemingly endless struggle for High King Brian to keep rival kings pacified
column2: it seems the unrest in Ireland has finally died down. With all of the Irish kings finally acknowledging him as the rightfull High King
column3: High King Brian has decided to hold a ceremony at Saint Patrick's Cathedral in Armagh to announce his dominion over all of Ireland. Much to the surprise of all in attendance
column4: Brian is announced not as Rí hÉrenn Uile
column5: King of All Ireland

column1: celt.23.a;I am finally High King in more than name;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.23.b;Not just High King
column2: Imperator Scotorum;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.23.c;Long live the High King;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.23.d;Great another King to deal with;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.23.e;Now I just need to figure out where Cathay is...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.23.f;An unexpected development;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.23.g;I have a bad feeling about this;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.23.h;Anyone can call themselves emperor these days;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.24.title;An Ultimatum;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.24.desc;An emissary from the [k_high_kingdom_of_ireland.Holder.GetTitledFirstName] has arrived with a message demanding that the [Root.Title.GetFullBaseName] submit and become a proper vassal of the [k_high_kingdom_of_ireland.Holder.GetTitle] or else face war;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.24.a;If it’s a war [k_high_kingdom_of_ireland.Holder.GetSheHe] wants
column2: it’s a war [k_high_kingdom_of_ireland.Holder.GetSheHe] shall get;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.24.b;I suppose I don't have much of a choice;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.25.title;Offer Refused;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.25.desc;[From.GetTitledName] has rudely rejected our very generous offer to submit to our authority. We have no choice now but to go to war;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.25.a;So be it;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.26.title;Offer Accepted;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.26.desc;[From.GetTitledName] has accepted our very generous offer to submit to our authority.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.26.a;Excellent;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.27.title;An Embarrassing Defeat;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.27.desc;Our failure to subjugate a recalcitrant Irish King has cast doubt on our authority as High King! Our tributaries are now contesting our right to rule!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.27.a;Curses;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.29.title;High Kingship Usurped!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.29.desc;[Root.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick] has usurped the title of High King from [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick]! The kings who had paid [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick] tribute have taken this opportunity to reassert their independence.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
#Events that give out authority
celt.30.title;Rí In Chóicid;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.30.desc;I have become king of [From.GetBaseName]
column2: one of the fifths of Ireland. Traditionally the High King was the king of one of the fifths who managed to achieve hegimony over the kings of the other fifths. Ruling one of the fifths of Ireland will surely improve claim to the High Kingship!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.31.title;King of Tara;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.31.desc;I have gained control of the Hill of Tara. The Hill of Tara is the traditional seat of the High King of Ireland
column2: and is the site of the High King's coronation stone Lia Fáil. Controlling Tara will certainly improve my claim to be High King!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.32.title;Meath Submits;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.32.desc;Meath
column2: one of the fifths of Ireland
column3: has been subjugated and now pays tribute to us. This is a sure sign of my right to be High King!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.33.title;Ulster Submits;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.33.desc;Ulster
column2: one of the fifths of Ireland
column3: has been subjugated and now pays tribute to us. This is a sure sign of my right to be High King!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.34.title;Leinster Submits;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.34.desc;Leinster
column2: one of the fifths of Ireland
column3: has been subjugated and now pays tribute to us. This is a sure sign of my right to be High King!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.35.title;Munster Submits;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.35.desc;Munster
column2: one of the fifths of Ireland
column3: has been subjugated and now pays tribute to us. This is a sure sign of my right to be High King!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.36.title;Connacht Submits;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.36.desc;Connacht
column2: one of the fifths of Ireland
column3: has been subjugated and now pays tribute to us. This is a sure sign of my right to be High King!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.37.title;An [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] High King;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.37.desc1;Another [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] has claimed the High Kingship! The [Root.getOnlyDynastyName] bloodline has controlled the High Kingship for as long as anyone can remember
column2: even going so far as to claim that only an [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] can be High King. By tradition the branches of the family take turns as High King but an ambitious family member can always find a way to take their turn early.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.37.desc2;Another Uí Néill has claimed the High Kingship! The Uí Néill bloodline has controlled the High Kingship for as long as anyone can remember
column2: even going so far as to claim that only an Uí Néill can be High King. By tradition the branches of the family take turns as High King but an ambitious family member can always find a way to take their turn early.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.37.a;Not on my watch;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.37.b;It will be my turn next;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.37.c;Hey I could be High King too if I wanted;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.38.title;Orderly Succession;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.38.desc;[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick] has died. As [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s Tanist I have been chosen to succeed [FromFrom.GetHerHim] as High King and it seems even even the other branches of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] have decided to acknowledge your right to the High Kingship;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.38.a;My right to rule is undeniable;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.39.title;Major Victory!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.39.desc;I have led my men to victory in a major battle! The bards will surely tell of this day for years to come;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.39.a;My legend grows;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.41.title;Hostage Taken!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.41.desc;I have taken an important hostage from my enemy
column2: proving my might as a King.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.41.a;No one takes hostages better than me;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.42.title;Of Nine Hostages;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.42.desc;I have managed to take so many hostages from my enemies that the bards have started to refer to me as a second Niall. Niall Noígíallach was perhaps the greatest High King in the history of Ireland. They say his skill in battle was so great that Niall managed to take hostages from each of the five provences of Ireland
column2: from the Picts
column3: from the Britons
column4: from the Saxons
column5: and even from the Franks. Having my name attached to such a legend has increased my prestige dramatically;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.42.a;I am a living legend!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.43.title;An Embarassing Setback;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.43.desc;I have recently faced a rather unfortunate failure in battle. While those with foresight can tell that this is obviously only a temporary reversal
column2: many in Ireland have begun to doubt my authority after witnessing such an embarassing failure.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.43.a;Curses;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.48.title;The Realm is at Peace;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.48.desc;I have managed to rule as the High King of Ireland at peace for 10 years;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.2000.desc;The Dál gCais
column2: a minor clann from Tuadhmhumhain
column3: has recently risen to prominence in the region. Now the leader of the Dál gCais
column4: Cennétig mac Lorcáin
column5: is making moves to claim the kingship of Tuadhmhumhain for himself.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2000.a;Not on my watch;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2000.b;Nothing to worry about I am sure;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2005.desc;Hordes of vikings pour forth from their longboats
column2: intent on plundering your lands once again. You lead a band of your strongest warriors to drive them off but you are quickly overrun. Before you even have time to think you take a hard blow to the head and the world goes dark.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2005.a;Not like this;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2006.desc;Your father Cennétig has passed away. Sadly he died before he could see his dream of being King of Munster fulfilled;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2006.a;It falls to me to achieve what he could not;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2007.desc;Your brother Mathgamain has passed away. Sadly he died before he could see his dream of being King of Munster fulfilled;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2007.a;It falls to me to achieve what he could not;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2008.desc;I have seized the Rock of Cashel from its unworthy king and in doing so have earned the right to call myself King of Munster;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2008.a;My ambitions will not stop here;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2009.desc;I have united the túatha of Munster under my authority. I now have the right to call myself King of Munster;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2009.a;My ambitions will not stop here;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.2011.desc;Lately Mathgamain has been trying to bolster support for his unjust rule of Munster. To this end he has been meeting with his opponents in the Kingdom to negotiate peace. If I can arrange for one of my co-conspirators to attend one of these meetings
column2: we should be able to capture Mathgamain;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2011.a;The Kingship will be mine again;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2011.a.tooltip;You will attempt to capture Mathgamain;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2012.desc;Recently Mathgamain has been looking to negotiate peace with his enemies within Munster. If I were to arrange a meeting with Mathgamain at a location of my choosing
column2: it would be a simple matter to capture him;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2012.a;Delightfully devilish [Root.GetFirstName];;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2012.a.tooltip;The plot leader will be informed of the plan;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.2013.desc;The plan worked perfectly! Mathgamain was lured to the home of one of my conspirators whereupon he was seized by my men. My allies have just presented Mathgamain to me and await my decision on what to do with him but in secret I had already made my decision long ago;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2013.a;He is too dangerous to be left alive;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.2014.desc;I have been invited to the home of one of my more unruly vassals to negotiate a peace settlement. Meeting at the home of a possible enemy is a risky proposition but after they swore an oath to guarantee  my safety
column2: I agreed to attend. However as soon as I arrived my host and his retinue drew their weapons and took me captive. They have delivered me to my hated enemy [FromFromFrom.GetDynName]
column3: a claimant to the Kingship of Munster. Clearly [FromFromFrom.GetFirstName] planned this trap as part of a ploy to take the kingship from me
column4: but the oaths of my captors and the laws of hospitality should at least protect my life. My captors are discussing what to do with me when suddenly [FromFromFrom.GetFirstName] draws his sword and plunges it into my chest;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2014.a;My kin will not let this betrayal go unanswered [FromFromFrom.GetFirstName];;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.2015.desc;[From.GetFirstName] comes to me with a plan to capture Mathgamain by luring him to [From.GetHerHis] home. Mathgamain is currenly looking to improve his control over Munster by making peace with the rebellious kings in the province so it should be a simple matter to convince him to attend a meeting to discuss peace with [From.GetFirstName];;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2015.a;I hope Mathgamain is prepared for an unforgettable meal;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2016.desc;[From.GetFirstName] has given his approval to the plan, now to inform my men;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2016.a;Mathgamain will not escape us;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2017.desc;[From.GetFirstName] has decided to make his move against Mathgamain;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2017.a;We are ready;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2018.desc;What was originally simply a plan to capture Mathgamain has ended with his death at the hands of [From.GetFirstName]. Though there are many who would view this act as a betrayal
column2: [From.GetFirstName] has decided to declare [From.GetHerselfHimself] [From.GetKingQueen] of Munster;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2018.a;There is no going back now;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2019.desc;My brother Mathgamain has died. The nefarious [From.Killer.GetDynName] lured him to the home of his lackey under false pretenses
column2: kidnapped him and then
column3: in violation of swarn oaths to ensure his safety
column4: struck him down. Even worse
column5: Mathgamain's murderer is now claiming to be the rightful King of Munster;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2019.a;I swear I will avenge the death of my brother;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.2020.desc;I have avenged the death of Mathgamain and reclaimed his title of King of Munster. However I now see the danger of allowing the lesser kings of Munster the freedom to do as they please. In order to secure my position as King of Munster
column2: I must bring the entire province under my direct control;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2020.a;My legend has only just begun;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2021.desc;At last Munster is completely under my control. Now that my work is done I find my thoughts turning outwards. I realize that Ireland itself is much like Munster was
column2: divided among warring powers and ruled by a king with little real power. Ireland's High Kings have been content to rest on their laurels but if a more effective ruler
column3: such as myself
column4: were to be High King then Ireland could finally stand united;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2021.a;The way forward is clear;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2022.title;High King Brian;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2022.desc;I have become the High King of Ireland but my rule is far from secure. The majority of the Irish kings only pay lip service to the High King
column2: while the relatives of the former High King are contesting my right to the title. If Ireland is to be strong enough to resist foreign invaders
column3: I must assert my authority over those who oppose me;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2022.a;A united Ireland is still so far away;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2023.title;A subjugated Ireland;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2023.desc;Ireland has long been subjugated by foreign powers
column2: her people have dreamed of freedom but were divided and lacked the strength to throw off their chains. Now I have united Ireland under my banner and Ireland finally has the power to reclaim her freedom from the foreigners;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2023.a;We will not wait even a day longer;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2024.title;Ireland United;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2024.desc;At long last all of Ireland is united under my control. No longer will Éire be plagued by meaningless feuding clanns
column2: nor will she suffer a powerless High King who merely watches as her wealth is ransaked by foreign invaders. The petty kings may grumble about the new role of the High King
column3: but they do not have the strength to oppose me and eventually they will be forced to accept the new order;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2024.a;Things will stabilize with time;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2025.title;A Nation Once Again;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2025.desc;In the name of God and of the dead generations from which she receives her old tradition of nationhood
column2: Ireland is once again a sovereign independent kingdom. The long usurpation of Irish freedom by a foreign people has ended and let any other would-be conquerors know that this freedom cannot be extinguished except by the destruction of the Irish people.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2025.a;Éirinn go Brách;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2028.desc;The usurper Brian has waged a bloody and distructive war across Ireland
column2: all to enforce his unjust authority. If Brian is not stopped soon
column3: our freedom may be lost forever. However
column4: Brian is always watching for any sign of insurrection and his might is not to be underestimated. Any move I make against him must be made with the utmost secrecy;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2028.a;First to look for an ally;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2028.b;This all sounds too risky to me;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2029.desc;[From.GetDynName]
column2: [From.GetPrimaryTitles]
column3: has sent a message requesting our aid against Brian
column4: High King of Ireland. [From.GetFirstName] has agreed to swear fealty to us should we free him from Brian;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2029.a;You have my support;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2029.b;I am not interested;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2030.desc;[From.GetTitledName] has agreed to support us against Brian;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2030.a;Excellent;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2031.desc;[From.GetTitledName] has decided not to support us against Brian;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2031.a;I will have to look elsewhere;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.2032.desc;I have secured a powerful foreign ally and prepared for war with Brian. If I wait any longer to act Brian will have strengthened his position too much and I fear he will be unstoppable;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2032.a;The time to act is now;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2032.b;I still need more time;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2033.title;The Battle of Clontarf;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.2033.desc.die;The armies of Brian and [From.GetDynName] meet early [GetWeekday] morning to do battle. At first the battle appears to be even and neither side is able to make much ground but after what seems like an entire day of fighting
column2: the tides turn and the forces of Brian are victorious. Brian's forces overwhelm and easily cut down their fleeing foes
column3: but eventually the glory of victory turns to sadness when it is discovered that Brian himself has fallen in battle;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2033.desc.live;The armies of Brian and [From.GetDynName] meet early [GetWeekday] morning to do battle. At first the battle appears to be even and neither side is able to make much ground but after what seems like an entire day of fighting
column2: the tides turn and the forces of Brian are victorious. Brian's forces overwhelm and easily cut down their fleeing foes as Brian himself leads the charge. The glory of victory is cut short when Brian takes a hard blow from a fleeing enemy and falls to the ground seemingly dead
column3: but a closer examination reveals that the wound was only superficial;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2033.a;There was so much more I wanted to achieve;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2033.c;A legend falls;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2033.d;That was a close call;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2033.e;At least we managed to kill Brian;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2033.f;All hope is lost;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2034.title;The Battle of Clontarf;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celf.2034.desc.die;The armies of Brian and [From.GetDynName] meet early [GetWeekday] morning to do battle. At first the battle appears to be even and neither side is able to make much ground but after what seems like an entire day of fighting
column2: the tides turn and the forces of Brian are victorious. Brian's forces overwhelm and easily cut down their fleeing foes. Brian had not participated in the battle himself but rather was camped nearby where he should have been safe. Unfortunately
column3: a fleeing enemy managed to enter Brian's tent and cut him down while he was praying;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celf.2034.desc.live;The armies of Brian and [From.GetDynName] meet early [GetWeekday] morning to do battle. At first the battle appears to be even and neither side is able to make much ground but after what seems like an entire day of fighting
column2: the tides turn and the forces of Brian are victorious. Brian's forces overwhelm and easily cut down their fleeing foes. In the chaos of the melee many of the victorious warriors are injured by their paniced foes
column3: but Brian himself managed to remain safe by staying far from the battle in his tent;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2034.a;There was so much more I wanted to achieve;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2034.b;I would have been fine in the thick of things too;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2034.c;A legend falls;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2034.d;Brian would never fall to some fleeing weakling;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2034.e;At least we managed to kill Brian;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2034.f;All hope is lost;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2036.title;Brian Bóruma;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2036.desc;Brian
column2: High King of Ireland
column3: has died. Brian rose from minor king of a small part of Munster to High King of Ireland though the use of his brilliant military skills. He dreamed of a free and united Ireland ruled by a High King with real power and while he managed to make major strides towards this goal in his life
column4: with his death all of the minor kings that Brian had managed to keep in check have resumed fighting among themselves for the title of High King. Though his achivements have not endured beyond his death
column5: Ireland will always remember her greatest High King Brian Bóruma;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2036.a;He was the greatest of High Kings;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2037.title;Brian Bóruma;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2037.desc;Brian
column2: High King of Ireland
column3: has died. Brian rose from minor king of a small part of Munster to High King of Ireland though the use of his brilliant military skills. He dreamed of a free and united Ireland ruled by a High King with real power and through brilliant strategy and unmatched might
column4: he brought this dream to fruition. Though he has now passed
column5: the High Kingdom he built will endure forever. Ireland will always remember her greatest High King Brian Bóruma;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2037.a;He was the greatest of High Kings;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2038.title;Rí hÉrenn Uile;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2038.desc;After a seemingly endless struggle for High King Brian to keep rival kings pacified
column2: it seems the unrest in Ireland has finally died down. With all of the Irish kings finally acknowledging him as the rightfull High King
column3: High King Brian has decided to hold a ceremony at Saint Patrick's Cathedral in Armagh to announce his dominion over all of Ireland. Much to the surprise of all in attendance
column4: Brian is announced not as Rí hÉrenn Uile
column5: King of All Ireland

column1: celt.2038.a;Not just High King
column2: Imperator Scotorum;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2038.b;An unexpected development;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2038.c;I have a bad feeling about this;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2038.d;Anyone can call themselves emperor these days;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2039.title;The Lochlann Question;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2039.desc;I have united the Gaelic people and secured their land against the threat of foreign invasion. Despite this
column2: the foreign raiders from faraway Lochlann continue to pillage and ransack our land. Though my armies can easily repel them
column3: each time they attack they managed to kill and plunder before we arrive. The only way we will ever be rid of these nuisances is to take the fight to them;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2039.a;To Lochlann!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2039.b;Better defenses is the answer not invasion;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2040.title;August Iartair Tuaiscirt Eorpa Uile;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

celt.2040.desc;The Northmen have long been a plague upon the civilized people of Europe. Their vikings loot and plunder with impunity and flee back to the safety of their longboats before defending armies can reach them while their kings wage war and conquer land without justification. Until now none seemed capable of inflicting any more than temporary losses on the Northmen but now
column2: against all odds
column3: [Root.GetDynName] of [Root.GetBaseName] has managed to subdue the Northmen. Already the uncontested lord of Great Britain and Ireland
column4: [Root.GetFirstNameWithNick] has now declared themselves Augustus of all of north-western Europe;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2040.a;My empire will surpass Rome!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2040.b;All hail Augustus [Root.GetFirstName]!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2040.c;Finally someone put a stop to those vikings;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2040.d;Augustus? I did not approve this!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2040.e;There is only one Augustus!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
augustus_of_northwestern_europe;Become Augustus of all of north-western Europe;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
augustus_of_northwestern_europe_desc;If I can add Scandinavia to my empire I will be worthy of calling myself Augustus of all of north-western Europe;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
plot_kill_mathgamain_title;Capture Mathgamain;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
plot_kill_mathgamain_desc;Mathgamain has grown too powerful. It is time I put him in his place;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
obj_unite_ireland_title;Unite Ireland;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
obj_unite_ireland_desc;[This.GetTitledFirstName] wants to unite Ireland once and for all;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2041.title;William Wallace;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.2041.desc;A rather curious report has reached my ears. While we have been waging war against the [scottish_enemy.Culture.GetName]
column2: it seems some other force has been battling the [scottish_enemy.Culture.GetName] independently. There are many rumors about the man who leads them
column3: some of them patently ridiculous
column4: but what is known is that he leads a sizable band of warriors and he has been successful at repelling the [scottish_enemy.Culture.GetName]. Having desired to meet this man
column5: I had ordered one of my vassals to find this man and bring him before me. This morning a fairly unassuming Scottish knight presented himself to me. He spoke 'I am William Wallace and I fight for the freedom of Scotland';;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.2041.a;I thought you were supposed to be 7 feet tall;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

convert_to_norsegael_desc;Our fellow Norsemen have been speaking Gaelic more and more often lately and seem to prefer Gaelic customs. Perhaps it is time to adopt these new ways before we are left behind...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
convert_to_cornish;Embrace Cornish Culture;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
convert_to_cornish_desc;Geographic isolation from our British brethren has made communication more difficult with them. Perhaps it is time we developed our own culture...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
convert_to_cumbric;Embrace Cumbric Culture;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
convert_to_cumbric_desc;Geographic isolation from our British brethren has made communication more difficult with them. Perhaps it is time we developed our own culture...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
convert_to_manx;Embrace Manx Culture;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

convert_to_manx_desc;Manx was once an insignificant branch of Gaelic culture but now it appears to have taken its place on the world stage. Perhaps it would benefit me to affiliate myself with this growing culture...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
convert_to_gaulish;Embrace Celtic Renaissance;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
convert_to_gaulish_desc;Our ancestors
column2: the Gauls
column3: were a Celtic people much like the inhabitants of the British Isles. Although our people have long abandoned the old ways in favor of Roman practices
column4: it seems Celtic practices have experienced a surprising resurgance. Perhaps I should embrace this Celtic Renaissance...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: #Artifact events ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.1017.title;The Chief Relic of the West;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.1017.desc;[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] journey bearing a ragged book missing it's cover. 'My [Root.GetLordLady]
column2: I have recovered the pages of the great Gospel of Columcille which had been stolen by heathens!'  [relic_hunter.GetHeShe] pauses briefly before continuing
column3:
'Though I am afraid the book's jeweled bindings were nowhere to be found.'

 Your initial feeling of disappointment is immediately washed away once you lay your eyes on the pages. The book is filled with the most stunning illustrations you have ever seen. A treasure binding can be replaced but it is clear that this masterwork cannot.

 Before you can make plans to have the great Gospel rebound
column4: you must decide on an appropriate reward for your waiting [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle].;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.1018.title;The Staff of Jesus;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.1018.desc;[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned
column2: bearing a jeweled bishop's crozier. Holding it delicately
column3: and clearly treating the object with devout respect
column4: your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] hands it to you. 'I have recovered the Bachal Isu
column5: the crozier of Saint Patrick and the very staff of the Lord Jesus Christ.'\n\nInspecting the staff in your hands
column6: you can tell that the staff's gold ornamentation is exquisite. There can be no doubt that this is the genuine Bachal Isu
column7: the very symbol of spiritual authority in Ireland.\n\nYour [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] waits patiently for you to speak.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.1019.desc;Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels
column2: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a jeweled cumdach. [relic_hunter.GetHeShe] claims that this book shrine contains The Cathach of St. Columba
column3: said to guarentee victory in battle.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.1020.desc;Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels
column2: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] presents you with an exquisitely decorated golden processional cross. My [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] assures me that this cross contains a fragment of the True Cross.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.1022.desc;My [rumor_councillor.GetJobTitle]
column2: [rumor_councillor.GetTitledFirstName]
column3: has brought me the most extraordinary news! Apparently [rumor_councillor.GetSheHe] has uncovered a rumor concerning a truly legendary artifact. [rumor_councillor.GetFirstName] tells me that securing the artifact will be an epic quest worthy of King Arthur himself. [rumor_councillor.GetFirstName] requests that [rumor_councillor.getHeShe] be put in charge of organizing this expedition.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.1022.a;My knights are at your disposal;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.1022.a.TT;§Y[rumor_councillor.GetJobTitle] [rumor_councillor.GetFirstName]§! immediately begins to search for the legendary artifact.\n;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.1022.b;Perhaps someone else would be more suited for this task;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.1022.b.TT;§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! can ask one of [Root.GetHerHis] councilors to search for the legendary artifact.\n;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
relic_rumor_epic;Rumor of a Legendary Artifact;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
relic_rumor_epic_desc;This character has been reached by a rumor of a legendary artifact! They can send one of their councilors to organize a search.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.1023.title;The Holy Grail;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.1023.desc;After years spent questing far from home
column2: your knights
column3: led by [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName]
column4: have returned. Bowing before you
column5: your knights present a small box to you. Your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] speaks 'My Lord after many trials we have completed the great mission of King Arthur. We have recovered the Holy Grail itself!'\n\nBarely able to contain your excitement
column6: you open the box and see a simple chalice. The cup Jesus used to serve wine at The Last Supper
column7: the vessel that caught the blood of Christ
column8: the relic that King Arthur sought. There is no artifact as storied as the one you now hold in your hands.\n\nNo doubt the bards will tell of this accomplishment for years to come
column9: but your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] seems to be awaiting a more immediate reward.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.1024.title;The Spear of Destiny;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.1024.desc;[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName]
column2: flanked by your loyal knights
column3: has returned
column4: bearing an ancient looking lance. Your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] and your knights kneel and offer the lance to you. 'We have recovered the Holy Lance that pierced the side of the Lord
column5:
Jesus Christ.'

Holding the lance in your hands you can feel the significance of this relic. It is said that Jesus bled blood and water when his side was pierced by Saint Longinus. Surely a weapon that has been touched by the Blood of Christ would make its wielder invincible in battle!

Smiling as [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] sees the realization of the lance's potential power creep onto your face
column6: [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] waits patiently for you to speak.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: celt.1025.title;The Shroud of Jesus;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
celt.1025.desc;At long last
column2: [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] and your knights have come home from their quest to find a powerful artifact. Holding a small metal box
column3: your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] appears befor you and
column4: bowing
column5: offers it to you. 'My Lord, I have searched far and wide
column6: and have found you the burial shroud of Jesus Christ
column7: himself!'\n\nOpening the box to sate your curiosity
column8: you indeed find what appears to be a burial shroud of some sort
column9: though an unremarkable one. Just as you begin to question the authenticty of the find
column10: you notice the image of a man's face that bears an unmistakable resemblance to the face of Jesus! There can be no further doubt that this is the genuine article.\n\nSeemingly Expecting you to speak
